title: Plots Demo
text:
Plot function pair (x(u), y(u)). See Figure 1 for an example.


Code
using Plots

plot(sin, 
     x->sin(2x), 
     0, 
     2π, 
     leg=false, 
     fill=(0,:lavender))





Figure 1: Parametric Plots

title: Jupyter Notebook demo
text:
This is a test of using a Jupyter notebook to make a Quarto page


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0,2,0.01)
theta = 4 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(subplot_kw={'projection': 'polar'})
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5,1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()





Figure 1: A line plot on polar axes






In the cell below we show code and results

1 + 1

2


We can include LaTeX equations: \[E=mc^2\] And inline equations too: \(c = \sqrt{a^2 + b^2}\)

title: Quarto Basics
text:
Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.001)
theta = 40 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()





Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis




Here is some text
The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog


Code
1 + 1


2
